org.opentrafficsim.core.unit

Class Unit<U extends Unit<U>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opentrafficsim.core.unit.Unit<U>
  • Type Parameters:
    U - the unit for transformation reasons
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccelerationUnit, AnglePlaneUnit, AngleSolidUnit, AreaUnit, DensityUnit, ElectricalChargeUnit, ElectricalCurrentUnit, ElectricalPotentialUnit, ElectricalResistanceUnit, EnergyUnit, FlowMassUnit, FlowVolumeUnit, ForceUnit, FrequencyUnit, LengthUnit, MassUnit, OffsetUnit, PowerUnit, PressureUnit, SIUnit, SpeedUnit, TimeUnit, TorqueUnit, VolumeUnit

    public abstract class Unit<U extends Unit<U>>
extends Object
implements Serializable
    All units are internally stored relative to a standard unit with conversion factor. This means that e.g., a meter is stored with conversion factor 1.0, whereas kilometer is stored with a conversion factor 1000.0. This means that if we want to display a meter as kilometers, we have to divide by the conversion factor.

    Copyright (c) 2014 Delft University of Technology, PO Box 5, 2600 AA, Delft, the Netherlands. All rights reserved.

    Version:
    May 15, 2014
    Author:
    Alexander Verbraeck

    UnitSystem unitSystem)
     throws UnitException
        Build a standard unit.
        Parameters:
        nameKey - the key to the locale file for the long name of the unit
        abbreviationKey - the key to the locale file for the abbreviation of the unit
        unitSystem - the unit system, e.g. SI or Imperial

      • Unit

        public Unit(String nameKey,
    String abbreviationKey,
    UnitSystem unitSystem,
    U referenceUnit,
    double conversionFactorToReferenceUnit)
     throws UnitException
        Build a unit with a conversion factor to another unit.
        Parameters:
        nameKey - the key to the locale file for the long name of the unit
        abbreviationKey - the key to the locale file for the abbreviation of the unit
        unitSystem - the unit system, e.g. SI or Imperial
        referenceUnit - the unit to convert to
        conversionFactorToReferenceUnit - multiply a value in this unit by the factor to convert to the given reference unit
        Throws:
        UnitException - when unit cannot be added to the list of units.

      • Unit

        public Unit(String nameKey,
    String abbreviationKey,
    UnitSystem unitSystem,
    boolean safe)
        Build a standard unit.
        Parameters:
        nameKey - the key to the locale file for the long name of the unit
        abbreviationKey - the key to the locale file for the abbreviation of the unit
        unitSystem - the unit system, e.g. SI or Imperial
        safe - Boolean; if true, a UnitException is silently ignored; if false a UnitException is an Error

      • Unit

        public Unit(String nameKey,
    String abbreviationKey,
    UnitSystem unitSystem,
    U referenceUnit,
    double conversionFactorToReferenceUnit,
    boolean safe)
        Build a unit with a conversion factor to another unit.
        Parameters:
        nameKey - the key to the locale file for the long name of the unit
        abbreviationKey - the key to the locale file for the abbreviation of the unit
        unitSystem - the unit system, e.g. SI or Imperial
        referenceUnit - the unit to convert to
        conversionFactorToReferenceUnit - multiply a value in this unit by the factor to convert to the given reference unit
        safe - Boolean; if true, a UnitException is silently ignored; if false a UnitException is an Error

    • Method Detail

      • getUnits

        public static <V extends Unit<V>> Set<V> getUnits(Class<V> unitClass)
        Return a set of defined units for a given unit type.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the unit type to use in this method.
        Parameters:
        unitClass - the class for which the units are requested, e.g. ForceUnit.class
        Returns:
        the set of defined units belonging to the provided class. The empty set will be returned in case the unit type does not have any units.

      • getAllUnitsOfThisType

        public final Set<Unit<U>> getAllUnitsOfThisType()
        Return a copy of the set of all defined units for this unit type.
        Returns:
        the set of defined units belonging to this Unit class. The empty set will be returned in case the unit type does not have any units.

        public abstract U getStandardUnit()

      • getSICoefficientsString

        public abstract String getSICoefficientsString()
        Returns:
        the SI standard coefficients for this unit, e.g., kgm/s2 or m-2s2A or m^-2.s^2.A or m^-2s^2A (not necessarily normalized)

        public static Set<Unit<?>> lookupUnitWithSICoefficients(String normalizedSICoefficientsString)
        Parameters:
        normalizedSICoefficientsString - the normalized string (e.g., kg.m/s2) to look up
        Returns:
        a set with the Units belonging to this string, or an empty set when it does not exist

        Parameters:

        Returns:
